sen.j: 中院 通方（なかのいん みちかた、文治5年（1189年） - 暦仁元年12月28日 (旧暦)（1239年2月3日））は、鎌倉時代初期の公卿、故実家で歌人。
sen.e: Michikata NAKANOIN (1189 - February 3, 1239) was a Kugyo (high court noble) as well as an authority of ancient practice of customs and a poet, who lived during the early Kamakura period.
Michikata NAKANOIN (1189 - February 3, 1239) was a Court noble, an authority of ancient practice of customs and a poet who lived during the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 公卿→a high court noble"who"の前のカンマは特に必要ないので、削除しました。
sen.e: Michikata NAKANOIN (1189 - February 3, 1239) was a Court noble, an authority of ancient practice of customs and a poet who lived during the early Kamakura period.

sen.j: 源通親の子、母は藤原範兼の娘・範子。
sen.e: He was the son of MINAMOTO no Michichika, and his mother was FUJIWARA no Norikane's daughter, Noriko.
He was the son of MINAMOTO no Michichika, and his mother was FUJIWARA no Norikane's daughter, Noriko.
He was the son of MINAMOTO no Michichika, and his mother was FUJIWARA no Norikane's daughter, Noriko.

sen.j: 中院家の祖とされている。
sen.e: It is said that he was the ancestor of the Nakanoin family.
He is considered to have been the founder of the Nakanoin family.
sen.cmt: 祖→the founderとされている→be considered to have been（～と考えているの意味なので、変更しました。）
sen.e: He is considered to have been the founder of the Nakanoin family.
His another name was Michikata TSUCHIMIKADO.
He is also known as Michikata TSUCHIMIKADO.
sen.cmt: 別名→also known as（用語リストのレビュー結果を参照し、変更しました。）
sen.e: He is also known as Michikata TSUCHIMIKADO.

sen.j: 6歳で従五位下を授けられ、翌年には父の知行国であった因幡国が与えられる。
sen.e: At the age of 6, he was conferred Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), and the next year he was given Inaba Province, which was once his father's chigyo-koku (provincial fiefdom).
He was conferred to the Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) at the age of six, and the next year, he was given Inaba Province which was once his father's chigyo-koku (provincial fiefdom).
sen.cmt: 従五位下を授けられる→conferred to the Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)
sen.e: He was conferred to the Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) at the age of six, and the next year, he was given Inaba Province which was once his father's chigyo-koku (provincial fiefdom).

sen.j: 建暦元年（1211年）に蔵人頭となって翌年に公卿に列した。
sen.e: In 1211, he became Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain), and the next year, he was admitted as a member of Kugyo (high court nobles).
In 1211, he became Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain), and the next year, he ranked as one of the Court nobles.
In 1211, he became Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain), and the next year, he ranked as one of the Court nobles.

sen.j: 以後、参議・検非違使別当・中納言を歴任するが、承久の乱後恐懼処分を受けて謹慎した。
sen.e: Since then, he consecutively held the posts of Sangi (councilor), Kebiishi no betto (Superintendent of the Imperial Police) and Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), however, he was sanctioned by the postwar purge after the Jokyu War and he was obliged to put a rein on his own behavior.
sen.cmt: 乱後恐懼→postwar purgeとしました。
sen.e: Thereafter, although he held various posts such as Sangi (councilor), Kebiishi no betto (Superintendent of the Imperial Police) and Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), he was obliged to put a rein on his own behavior due to a punishment on suspension given after the Jokyu War.
sen.cmt: 恐懼処分→punishment on suspension（謹慎処分の意味なので、変更しました。）
sen.e: Thereafter, although he held various posts such as Sangi (councilor), Kebiishi no betto (Superintendent of the Imperial Police) and Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), he was obliged to put a rein on his own behavior due to a punishment on suspension given after the Jokyu War.

sen.j: 乱後は姉の承明門院とその孫邦仁王（土御門天皇の子、後の後嵯峨天皇）を後見した。
sen.e: After the war, he undertook the guardianship of his older sister Shomeimonin and her grandson Prince Kunihito (Emperor Tsuchimikado's son, and later Emperor Gosaga).
After the War, he became a guardian for his older sister, Shomeimonin, and her grandson, Prince Kunihito (Emperor Tsuchimikado's son, and later Emperor Gosaga).
sen.cmt: 乱後→After the War（「乱」は、前述の承久の乱を指していると解釈し、大文字表記にしました。）
sen.e: After the War, he became a guardian for his older sister, Shomeimonin, and her grandson, Prince Kunihito (Emperor Tsuchimikado's son, and later Emperor Gosaga).

sen.j: 安貞元年（1227年）中納言となり、2年後に大納言に転じる。
sen.e: In 1227, he became Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), and two years' later, he was ascended to 大納言Dainagon (chief councilor of state).
In 1227, he became Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), and two years after that, he was promoted to Dainagon (chief councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 2年後→two years after that（その2年後なので、変更しました。）転じる→be promoted to（昇進したの意味なので、変更しました。）
sen.e: In 1227, he became Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), and two years after that, he was promoted to Dainagon (chief councilor of state).

sen.j: その間に宮廷行事における服装などの有職故実についてまとめた『飾抄』を著した。
sen.e: During that period, he wrote "Kazarisho" (record of costume and lore), a book about Yushoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette), such as the dress code in the events and rituals in the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 宮廷行事→events and rituals in the Imperial Courtとしました。『飾抄』 (かざりしょう）→"Kazarisho" (record of costume and lore)としました。
sen.e: During that period, he wrote "Kazarisho" (record of costume and lore), a book about Yushoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) such as dress code in the events and rituals in the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: (record of ～)の前のスペースを1つ削除しました。
sen.e: During that period, he wrote "Kazarisho" (record of costume and lore), a book about Yushoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) such as dress code in the events and rituals in the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 歌人としては「新勅撰和歌集」他に10首収められている。
sen.e: As a poet, his 10 poems were included in "Shin chokusen wakashu" (A new anthology of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command).
As a poet, 10 of his poems were included in "Shin chokusen wakashu" (A new anthology of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command) and other anthologies.
sen.cmt: 他→other anthologies（訳抜けしていたので、補いました。）
sen.e: As a poet, 10 of his poems were included in "Shin chokusen wakashu" (A new anthology of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command) and other anthologies.

sen.j: 暦仁元年（1238年）大納言に昇ったものの、間もなく病で倒れ、その年の暮れに50歳の生涯を閉じた。
sen.e: Although he was promoted to Dainagon (in 1238, shortly he fell ill and at the end of the old calendar year (1239)January 1239 (表記の変更), he ended his 50 years' life.

Although he was promoted to Dainagon in 1238, he fell ill shortly after that and finished his 50-year life at the end of the old calendar year 1238 (equivalent to January 1239 according to the new calendar).
sen.cmt: 暦任元年（1238年）→in 1238（"in 1238"の前の括弧は不要なので、削除しました。）間もなく→shortly after that（「その後間もなく」の意味なので、"after that"を付け加えました。）その年の暮れに→at the end of the old calendar year 1238 (equivalent to in January 1239 according to the new calendar)（新暦に換算した場合の表記を、補足説明として付け加えました。）
sen.e: Although he was promoted to Dainagon in 1238, he fell ill shortly after that and finished his 50-year life at the end of the old calendar year 1238 (equivalent to January 1239 according to the new calendar).
